projectPurpose: To provide a disassembler and executable analysis tool with a strong focus on supporting binaries compiled from the Rust programming language.
mainFeatures: Inspection of binary content and debug information (DWARF/PDB)
Support for multiple architectures (X86-64, AArch64/Armv7, Riscv64gc/Riscv32gc, MIPS-V)
Viewing assembly listing alongside source code

alternatives.name: IDA Pro
mainFeatures: Supports a vast array of file formats and architectures

alternatives.name: Ghidra
mainFeatures: Supports a wide range of processors and file formats
Extensible through scripting (Java, Python) and plugins

alternatives.name: Binary Ninja
mainFeatures: Interactive disassembler, decompiler, and binary analysis platform
High-quality API for automation (C++, Python, Rust)
Visualize control flow and stack layouts
Supports various architectures and file formats

alternatives.name: Capstone Engine
mainFeatures: Implemented in pure C with bindings for many languages (including Rust)

alternatives.name: iced-x86
mainFeatures: Fast and correct x86/x64 instruction decoder, disassembler, assembler, encoder library
Supports all Intel and AMD instructions
Supports various formatter syntaxes (masm, nasm, gas, Intel)

marketPositioning: BiTE positions itself as a disassembler with a unique emphasis on providing comprehensive support for binaries compiled from the Rust programming language. While established tools like IDA Pro, Ghidra, Binary Ninja, and radare2 offer broad architectural support, BiTE aims to provide deeper, more integrated analysis capabilities specifically for the nuances of Rust binaries and their associated debug information. Its open-source nature and implementation in Rust differentiate it from commercial offerings and provide a specialized alternative within the broader reverse engineering tool landscape.
